text: The 1919 Argentine Primera División was the 28th season of top-flight football in Argentina. The official "Asociación Argentina de Football" (AFA) league championship was abandoned mid season by the majority of the clubs, which joined the new "Asociación Amateurs de Football" (AAmF) while six clubs remained with the official body. In the AFA league, Boca Juniors was crowned champion with 14 fixtures to be played, while Racing Club won its 7th league title at AAmF.Argentina 1919 at RSSSF Club Eureka debuted in the AFA championship, while Vélez Sársfield played its first Primera División championship in the AAmF after being disaffiliated from the official body.Argentina: 1ra. División Asociacion Amateurs 1919 at Historia y Futbol ==Final tables== ===Asociación Argentina de Football - Copa Campeonato=== ===Asociación Amateurs de Football=== ==References== Category:Argentine Primera División seasons Prim Category:1919 in South American football
title: 1919 Argentine Primera División
